units.title: Culture organoids
units.text: 1 Culture organoids (or organoid co-cultures) in 50 µl of Matrigel and 200 µl of medium in a standard 96-well tissue culture plate.
units.rationale: Initial step to grow organoids before any treatment.

units.title: S phase cell labeling
units.text: 2 Add 127IdU directly to culture medium to a ﬁnal concentration of 25 µM (10 µl of 0.5 mM stock added to 200 µl of medium). Gently rotate the plate by hand ﬁve times for 10 s to mix the medium and incubate the plate for 25 min at 37 °C and 5% CO2.
units.rationale: Labels cells in S phase for downstream analysis.

units.title: Phosphatase and protease inhibitor treatment
units.text: 3 Add the protease inhibitor cocktail (100× stock; see Reagents) and PhosSTOP (40× stock; see Reagents) directly to culture medium, gently rotate the plate by hand ﬁve times for 10 s and incubate for 5 min at 37 °C and 5% CO2.
units.rationale: Preserves signaling and antigen integrity during fixation.

units.title: Fixation
units.text: 4 Remove culture medium by pipetting. Add 200 µl of prewarmed (37 °C) 4% (vol/vol) PFA into each well, taking care not to disrupt Matrigel. Incubate for 60 min at 37 °C and 5% CO2.
units.rationale: Stabilizes cell-state and PTM profiles in situ.

units.title: Live/dead discrimination
units.text: 6 Remove PBS by pipetting. Add 200 µl of 0.25 µM 194cisplatin/PBS solution to each well and incubate for 10–15 min on a rocker at room temperature.
units.rationale: Stains dead cells to enable their identification during analysis.

units.title: TOBis barcoding (optional)
units.text: 8 Transfer 200 µl of pre-aliquoted TOBis barcodes to corresponding organoid samples in a 96-well plate (from Step 7). Any barcode combination can be used to stain any culture condition (Supplementary Tables 3 and 4). Incubate the cells overnight at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Labels samples for multiplexed downstream de‑barcoding.

units.title: Prepare dissociation solution
units.text: 11 Make up a dissociation solution of fresh 0.5 mg/ml dispase II, 0.2 mg/ml collagenase IV and 0.2 mg/ml DNase I in PBS at room temperature.
units.rationale: Creates enzyme mix to release single cells from organoids.

units.title: Extracellular stain
units.text: 21 Centrifuge cells at 800g for 5 min at room temperature, discard the supernatant and resuspend cells in 50 µl of CSB.
units.rationale: Prepares cells for addition of extracellular antibody cocktail.

units.title: Permeabilization
units.text: 25 Resuspend cells in 1 ml of 0.1% (vol/vol) Triton X-100/PBS, gently vortex and incubate for 30 min on a rocker at room temperature.
units.rationale: Permeabilizes cells to allow intracellular antibody access.

units.title: Intracellular stain
units.text: 31 Prepare intracellular antibody cocktail by mixing the antibody panel (see Supplementary Table 2 for an example) at desired concentrations in CSB (total volume up to 50 µl).
units.rationale: Generates the antibody mix for detecting intracellular PTM targets.
